article.headline: Sam Houston St. 90, Lamar 63
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas -- Corey Allmond scored 24 points to lead Sam Houston to a 90-63 victory over Lamar in Southland Conference play on Wednesday night. The victory makes Sam Houston's record 13-5 and 5-0 in Southland action, only the second time in the Bearkats' 23 years in the league for Sam Houston to win their first five games. Allmond made 4 of 6 from behind the arc. Ashton Mitchell scored 14 points and Preston Brown added 12 for Sam Houston. Kendrick Harris led Lamar (10-11, 2-4) with 15 points, and Anthony Miles added 10 points. The Bearkats outrebounded Lamar 41-31 with Antuan Bootle pulling down a game-high 11 for Sam Houston. Sam Houston never trailed, jumping out to a 20-10 lead on a lay-up by Allmond eight minutes into the game. The Bearkats built a 48-31 lead by intermission and led by as many as 31 points in the second half.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
